events.message: I received my new headphones today, but unfortunately the left earcup has a noticeable scratch and seems faulty. I’m very disappointed with the condition it arrived in.
The reported issue has been identified as a product defect caused by visible damage and malfunction in the left earcup of the headphones.
A support agent has been assigned to address the reported issue with the defective headphones.
Hello! I’m sorry to hear that your headphones arrived damaged. I’m here to help you get this resolved as quickly as possible.
Could you please provide photos showing the scratch and the faulty earcup so we can review the damage and proceed with the next steps?
I have attached several photos that clearly show the scratch on the left earcup as well as the earcup not functioning properly when I try to use it.
Thank you for the photos. We can offer you a replacement pair of headphones free of charge or a full refund if you prefer. Please let us know which option you would like.
I would like to go ahead with the replacement option, thanks for resolving this so swiftly.
Your replacement order has been processed and will be shipped to you within 3 business days. We appreciate your patience and understanding.
We wanted to check in and confirm that you have received your replacement headphones and that everything is working perfectly now.
Yes, the replacement headphones arrived yesterday and they work perfectly. Thank you for your quick support and good service.
We are glad to hear that your issue is resolved. We are closing the support case now, but feel free to contact us again if you need any further assistance.
